title: 90% of my Bronze career I have spent telling people to buy %hp damage vs 2 or more tanks.
body:
Save me from saying it -

Every
Single
Game.

replies.body: Well you better listen to OP or you will feed.

>buy %hp damage 

Except in most cases this is actually worse then just getting %pen

The 2 items that do % Max health damage are BotRK and Liandry's.

Liandry's is only useful for DoT champions (and it's %damage is poor)

And Blade does Physical damage anyway, so if the enemy is tanky enough your doing next to nothing anyway.

%pen>%hp

6% of 1000 is 60 dmg on hit at the point at which they're at 1000 health - once they hit around 2000 to 2400 that's 120-145 dmg so for the duration of chunking them down from 2.4K health you'll be doing 145 dmg for the first few hits, then about 100 once they start losing hp then about 60 bonus dmg once they hit around 1K health - and you have an execute based on max HP which helps you kite as well (useful vs tanks).

The stats from the item are great and I have to disagree - you shouldn't be waiting to buy it until they are tanky it should be a pre-emptive buy based on their HP scaling or most likely itemisation, or a semi-pre-emptive once they have or are looking like they will be building HP (IE if they have wardens mail and you don't have a lot of AD in which case they most likely wont turn it into just frozen heart - or if they are Champions that have abilities that scale on health IE mundo, nautilus etc and Last whisper comes in later - as it's only really effective by the time they have 100+ armor (cost wise) and you can have an infinity edge and blade of the ruined king by about the time they've finished an armor item completely and hit 120ish armor and you only really have to go a few levels without the armor shred - and the stats from the blade far exceed the benefit of something that is for aiming tanks - but offers few other stats. (Last whisper).

I'm not as educated about Liandry's but I disagree on it only being for Champions with DoT's (Teemo and Brand) because Brand gets engaged on heavily and Teemo has to have map dominance for it to be effective and as such these Champs miss out on having as much benefit from it as others who can utilise it more effectively but with a little more effort (like kat poking for example or Ahri as she can poke a fair bit and get a few procs - especially on tanks - during trades etc) and as such I think it is a good buy as you can easily grab Haunting Guise which adds nice stats and eases pressure on AD's as enemies have to consider buying mixed resistances - and as a precursor to Luden's, Deathcap or Morello's/Chalice it is easy to build into once enemies have built HP or can be left in it's earlier stage - and adds a lot of impact to team fights and poking etc once built - which is much needed in League atm - and with many tanks and a lot of AP bursters nerfed and with deathfire removed and with a predominance of and significant danger because of the impact Tanks/bruisers can have if they aren't taken down relatively quickly or poked/deterred from engages or heavy engages etc I think it's an item that's often overlooked and at the expense of games.

Easy to build early - easy to upgrade if need be - and still a good item if left unfinished - and in relation to blade of the ruined king - great stats added, significant impact on tanks and bruisers and still useful in ADC trades etc, great with a lot of supports taking HP related items too and even still - good if they don't because it has such nice and balanced stats. I don't know why anyone would not consider taking these items when vs'ing 2 or 3 tanks, tanky bruisers, potential tanks, HP benefitting champions or when general teams tank up late game and if you have a lot of burst its often a good idea as a pre-emptive and it's often easy to see tank teams incoming - the item does a lot more than a lot of other item choices, its a generally safer choice and almost any ADC can take it with ease - and many AP's can take Haunting Guise and almost always gain a lot out of it - and if not it is still better to have in a lot of cases where enemies look like they may tank - and I know there are a few tank buster Champions or Champs that deal % HP damage or have %HP missing Executes (Poppy, Riven, Garen, Lee Sin, Mundo, Elise - but in cases where you are vsing 2-3 tanky champs and don't have 2 of these Champs on your team - Items like Liandry's and Blade of the Ruined King are great early or even late additions to your builds - and even if you do are still often greatly beneficial.

Tank =/= Health Tank

What your not taking into account in any of this is the fact that your only
a) talking about health tanks with 0 resistances
b) not even considering resistances.

>6% of 1000 is 60 dmg on hit at the point at which they're at 1000 health - once they hit around 2000 to 2400 that's 120-145 dmg so for the duration of chunking them down from 2.4K health you'll be doing 145 dmg for the first few hits, then about 100 once they start losing hp then about 60 bonus dmg once they hit around 1K health - and you have an execute based on max HP which helps you kite as well (useful vs tanks).

Here's a more realistic example

2400 health, 100 armor, this means your dealing 72.5 bonus damage, take into account the fact that 100 armor is actually a small amount (an AP mid building Zhonya's can get them to 100) and you start realizing that your talking out your ass.

I'm not saying blade is a bad item, i'm saying that your being truly bronze in your assumption.

Lets take the same sort of enemy and consider the 35% armor pen and give them a last whisper instead

2400 health, 100 armor dropped to 65, assuming you have 200 AD, your looking at going from 100 damage, to 121 damage, and this scales harder off your AD, and procs on things OTHER then Auto's

Fact is several champions don't scale as hard off the AS blade gives, and for them Last Whisper is the more realistic option to being able to shred tanks, especially if you take into account the armor that they are going to have.



As for Liandry's, it's a completely gold inefficient as an item, which is why you need DoT's to proc it effectively (the fact that you only mention brand and teemo is just pathetic.)

Do you want to know what the difference between liandry's and Haunting Guise is?

5 AP (because you need to buy an amp tome which can be turned to something else)
100 HP
The Liandry's Passive
980 gold

Read this a few times.

Now that it's sunk in lets go to what you actually get from the passive.

2% current health per second for 3 seconds.

Lets bring back in 2400 health assuming you do a proc on someone with no MR and they stay at full health, you did 141 damage over those 3 seconds

For that 980 gold i can get a blasting wand for 40 AP and probably do more damage with the flat AP scaling off my ability's on nearly any mid laner.

Unlike the blade that actually ends up paying for the stat inefficiency, Liandry's doesn't unless you are a Malz, Cassio, Singed, Amumu, Brand, Rumble, Swain

All of these can proc the Liandry's for a prolonged amount of time, and actually make the item become cost efficient.

I know I was talking about before Resistances but it's easy to see that your endgame damage output is better vs tanks with Blade of the ruined King than its counterparts.

It's a counter to tanks and you're basically saying don't buy it - when it wins games vs tanks.

I must say Liandry's isn't that great but it's good on pokers and if you have CC or are considering buying a Rylai's - also bear in mind its effect is increased on anyone with movement impairments so allied CC helps max its damage.

I don't see how you can diss it that much though, it wins games too.

>It's a counter to tanks and you're basically saying don't buy it - when it wins games vs tanks.

I'm not saying don't buy it, but it has to have some interaction with your champion or it's a waste.

There are many champions that rely on ability's over autos, all of them want Last Whisper instead of BotRK.

Your making a blanket statement which just doesn't work.

Also Liandry's is not as good as your trying to make it sound, Void staff is so much better on nearly every champion (the exception is ONLY those without mana costs.) that i didn't mention above, and even the ones i mentioned above tend to be better with void staff.

Your saying that the items win games, but in enclosed situations it's not the item winning the game, it's a mix of items.

For example lets go here and open these 3 links.

http://www.elophant.com/league-of-legends/item/the-bloodthirster/popularity
http://www.elophant.com/league-of-legends/item/blade-of-the-ruined-king/popularity
http://www.elophant.com/league-of-legends/item/last-whisper/popularity

These are the items and their win rates for their champions.

Have a look at Vayne on BotRK and Last Whisper, he wins 60% of the LW games and only 52% of the BotRK games.

This has nothing to do with Blade being worse, just LW being further down the build path, but what it does show is that there are a lot of champs that would rather anything over a BotRK.

Your blanket statements are just flat out wrong, and it's as simple as that, especially considering it's not rare to come up against 200+ armor opponents where your blade is doing shit all because you have no way to stop their Armor from stopping the damage.

As an added note, Blade is 84th in win rate, BT is 71st and LW is 32nd.

Other items that generally beat blade in win rate:
IE: 35th
Phantom Dancer: 44th
Youmuu's: 45th
Black Cleaver: 56th

Liandry's statistically is better, however it's by a minor % and tends to be used on the champions better for it (because anyone above bronze understands WHEN to have one)

Vayne is a late game hyper carry - I'm not surprised her win rate in games where last whisper has been purchased is higher than her blade of the ruined king games as Last Whisper is most often a late game item - which is where Vayne shines.

Blade offers stats useful versus non-HP heavy Champions too which is also why it is often taken earlier; as a deterrent to HP stacking, as an item to deal with Champions with high HP scaling or to counter those who will buy HP regardless - as even if they don't - it's stats are still great.

Your blade will only be doing sh*t all if you don't pick up a last whisper as well versus 2 or so armor stackers with high HP or HP items.

I can guarantee you your Infinity Edge will be doing sh*t all versus a 4K HP Mundo and a 3K HP Jarvan - and to add importance to the item, Champions like that often buy Thornmail and the lifesteal on Blade helps counter thorn - so there is an added bonus to taking it as most HP stackers consider armor - thorn being a common choice - and blade deters and helps deal with this and thorn doesn't return the %bonus damage- however on the flip side; that attack speed from blade is less useful against a randuins however on the flipside again as randuins is a sustain type item Blade is still more useful versus it in a lot of situations than an Infinity Edge as randuins adds a lot of HP adding to your blade damage.

Infinity Edge is often an item taken if you are leading, being replaced by bloodthirster in games where you need more duelling potential, to be able to stick in lane longer vs powerful harassers and as a more defensive option for if you are struggling in lane - it being a high win rate item is probably simply because it is often an item taken once you are in the lead - hence probably more likely to win that game.

I don't know why you're comparing Void and Liandry's - the items work well together - It's an item that will often replace a low AP item in your inventory and I'm not saying it's great but it shreds tanks and I think it and blade are items often not considered as useful - even though they are greatly useful.

You know what you convinced me, i am now taking Blade on every champ when i'm against 2 tanks because you talked out your ass hard enough.

You know, like Sivir or Draven, or Jayce.

Fact is again YOUR MAKING A BLANKET STATEMENT WHICH DOESN'T COVER ALL SITUATIONS.

Blade isn't a bad item, this is not what i'm saying.

What you are saying is take blade if they have 2+ tanks, which is wrong, if i'm Draven against 2+ tanks, i want BT, IE, LW then probably a PD.

EDIT: Also i never said Liandry's was bad, i'm saying your bullshit of 2+ tanks means must tank is bad, it's champion dependent not enemy champion dependent.
It's an item that covers those situations tho for every ADC. Even Draven.

Draven doesn't want a blade, because he doesn't want any of it's poor stats and he scales more off the Flat AD.

You're saying statements that are just flat out false.
How does Draven not benefit from Attack speed, raw damage, lifesteal and 6%current HP dmg when versing 2+ tanks? It works out as more damage overall than a BF Sword item.

> [{quoted}](name=KiStorm,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=0QqGMJeG,comment-id=0000000000010000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-04-24T15:24:24.555+0000)
>
> How does Draven not benefit from Attack speed, raw damage, lifesteal and 6%current HP dmg when versing 2+ tanks? It works out as more damage overall than a BF Sword item.

Who did your math for you? Did you do it yourself? Because it's wrong.

6% of 2K is 120 dmg Plus 25 AD, BT is 80 damage. 

Some AD Scalers get a better than 1:1 ratio for flat AD though but once enemies are hitting 3-4K HP its damage far exceeds that of a BT.

You have failed to consider IT'S DRAAAAAVEN

His Q doesn't scale off the BotRK passive, and he scales harder off the flat AD

Not to mention, your aim on the first back as draven is to either have a BF sword or a pickaxe, which doesn't build into BotRK.

And anyone that want's to build Crit, the BotRK passive fails to crit, so any champ that builds an IE doesn't want a BotRK.

Your maths is bad and you should feel bad.

I think in most games it's a must have. Maybe if you are stupidly fed it's unnecessary but it is a safer option - often even for these games.

Post IE - then build into IE or BT then take LW then a PD or QSS or banshees or whatever - Mercurial isn't necessary in many games only if they have heavy CC and a fair bit of magic damage and in these games IE if they have a lot of mixed damage usually - they most likely don't have a lot of tanking potential so you could probably opt out from it.

Build it later?

At what point are you planning to build it?

Lets see.

IE, BT, LW, PD, Scimitar and boots.

What are you suggesting in this sort of build you should get rid of for the blade?

>doesn't mean you don't benefit from it situationally.

And finally you realize what i've been trying to point out this entire time

IT'S SITUATIONAL NOT A MUST HAVE ITEM AGAINST 2+TANKS

You can build it later...

It does huge damage versus tanks.

Just because its synergy isn't as good as other items synergy, doesn't mean you don't benefit from it situationally.

> [{quoted}](name=KiStorm,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=0QqGMJeG,comment-id=000000000001000000000000000000000000000000010000,timestamp=2015-04-24T15:48:46.595+0000)
>
> 6% of 2K is 120 dmg Plus 25 AD, BT is 80 damage. 
> 
> Some AD Scalers get a better than 1:1 ratio for flat AD though but once enemies are hitting 3-4K HP its damage far exceeds that of a BT.

What you are forgetting is that it's the targets current health.

BT isn't that great on draven, but you said BotRK is better than any BF Sword item, and Infinity Edge, Shiv, Youmuu's and last whisper, will simply out damage any combination of BotRK and 3 other items.

You are bronze for a reason pal.

No I understand that lol - the example was just for someone with 2K HP - so after the first 10 or so seconds of fighting a tank at 4K HP the damage has gone down from 240 to 120 once they're at 2K HP so overall its damage is greater than BT would be for the entire fight - bearing in mind it has a max HP execute - and no it wont if you are versing enough HP...

>It works out as more damage overall than a BF Sword item.

*sigh*

I'm done trying to explain to you that your wrong.
I'm not wrong lol I know the maths and it works into your builds nicely.
can you write all of my essays for me tyvm <3
Haha.

im agreeing with that guy^^ i started reading this and then i scold down and i was like "nah fuck that shit" bloody hell guys, i personally think that IE and crit on champions scale better except on vayne, maybe later game i get it for the attack sped for lucian but thats about it and maybe the life steal, yes the passive helps and yes its a good item but seriously the flat ad on it doesn't work out for champions that need the flat ad and high ad damage. e.g. driven and jinx. but i understand where you are coming form but i believe you are wrong :D

It scales better than BF sword items though...

4K HP enemy, 240 bonus dmg each auto when you start to drop them as opposed to maybe an occasional crit - and its other stats on top.

but when they get low that bonus damage is gone, where as if you get IE shiv and many other crit chance items you have a pretty high chance of critical striking the enemy and therefore dropping there health, and the low ad on BOTRK is kinda low compared to like BT or IE, and seriously when you have like 100% AS and you crit you would rather crit then BOTRK, sorry just my opinion.
It fits into heaps of builds you can have crit as well...

but also having a high crit rate means you can get a crit almost every time you auto attack, i think honestly that BT would be better for your sustain against a tank thats trying to kill you, yes i understand and i get the BOTRK item on a arc and yes it works wonders on some but then again you want more damage and not to mention the fact that tanks aren't always the only person on the team.

High crit does equal more crits, but more attack speed from BoRK also means more crits. Also, the BoRK allows you to kite the tanks more if you need to with its active.
Also, guys its 8%.
However, not having BoRK does not mean the tanks can run through your team however they want though. I'm not gonna say let's definitely get it just because there is two tanks though. It would be hugely desirable for me if its was a Mundo top and Sion jungle, but let's say its uuh... Leona support and Rammus jungle. Those pen stats are gonna much more desirable and a much greater priority than a BoRK because of their huge amounts of resistances. Also need to consider who you have on your team though. Its nice when your team has a Black Cleaver on let's say Hecarim and you have a Trundle as they are gonna be shredding a lot of the armour off (and the tanks probably felt more inclined to get higher health because of it). Lot's of variables to consider and its not a case of how many tanks they have.
The conversation was about having to tell people to buy it though - sorry I didn't specify the situations as them being two tanks where Blade is preferable.

All good, I'm just weighing in on where I believe it should be bought and where it shouldn't. I don't know what you know.
Its 8% though, so its more desirable than you've been selling it as haha

It is nice against tanks... However, I'd be more inclined to build it depending on which tanks they are.
Also, keep in mind, the high priority high damage targets are going to fall faster to a BF sword than a BoRK for a lot of ADCs. Just because they have multiple tanks, doesn't mean you don't wanna be able kill the other guys faster.
While the tanks are just going to run through your team more or less unpunished.
